     Psychic Powers: rules for using Psykers and their Wyrd Powers in games of Necromunda, with rules for Sanctioned and Non-sanctioned Psykers along with Perils of the Warp;
     Skills: a fully up to date list of all the skills available to fighters;
     Rules and background for the following Hired Guns: Slate Merdana, Orlock Road Boss and Macula his Cyber-mastiff;


Baetrum Arturos III, Guilder Bounty Hunter; and Ortruum 8-8, Psykanarium Bounty Hunter.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Cawdor Gang Cards
Description:
Necromunda: Underhive contains a number of Tactics cards, which can be used to represent the myriad tricks and schemes employed by the gangs. Expand your games of Necromunda: Underhive – whichever gang you play – with this set of 26 extra cards. Included:


     12 Cawdor Tactics cards, which are for the exclusive use of the Cawdor gang;
     8 Gang Tactics cards, which can be used by any gang in Necromunda: Underhive;
     6 blank Fighter cards – perfect for the Champions and Leaders in your gang deck, these have been stamped with the House Cawdor crest.


—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Badzone Delta-7
Description:
This collection of double-sided board tiles expands and changes your games of Necromunda: Underhive by adding new, atmospheric places to fight - and new rules, which can be found in the Gang War 2 Gaming Supplement (including adaptations for Sector Mechanicus battles). Nine tiles are included, exactly the same size as the tiles found in the Necromunda: Underhive boxed game, and the hazards upon them include:


     Cult Ritual Chamber: a hidden shrine to the Ruinous Powers that can drive a man insane
     Collapsed Sections: these feature large pitfalls, and the shifting floors are easily affected by blasts
     Archaeotech Device: a functional, mysterious device from centuries ago - press the button and see what happens
     Furnace Floor: this gives off such violent heat that it can affect ranged attack
     Ventilation Tunnel: a huge fan whose turbulent currents can drag gangers to their doom
     Malfunctioning Generatorium: abandoned electrical machinery that can deliver a devastating shock
     Sludge Farm: massive vats of "biological run-off" which unwary gangers can fall into
     Flooded Passage: injured gangers can find it hard to keep their head above the water
     Sewage Channel: a dangerously fast-flowing stream of mycoprotein
     Promethium Cache: fuel spills, barrels and tanks that can be detonated by a wayward shot
     Unlit Corridors: their darkness obscures gangers, making ranged attacks more difficult
     Secure Vault: extremely tough and hard to get into
     Fungus Sprawl: not only does this fungus provide illumination, it boasts incredibly poisonous spores
     Waste Compactor: it's possible to climb out of this compactor - assuming nobody switches it on...
     Xenos Nesting Chamber: filled with egg sacs that can burst open with xenos hatchlings at any time


—description from the publisher

Name: Circus
Description:
In Circus, players have inherited the family business: an amazing circus. After many years waiting for the moment, players take the lead to manage all aspects of the business, including hiring new shows and managing exciting attractions.

Creating an attractive circus show is as important as managing all the business resources. After all, there is only one winner in the face of tough competition—the one who can turn their business into a real success.

summarized from publisher's website

Name: Steampunk Rally: Zhuge Liang & Lady Huang
Description:
Zhuge Liang & Lady Huang is a promotional character for Steampunk Rally.Rather than having the standard two cards, a cockpit and a machine, Zhuge Liang & Lady Huang have a single 1×2 card depicting a mechanised bull device.  
Bonus: If you lose exactly 1 part due to damage in the Damage Phase, all opponents take 2 damage for the next round. If you lose exactly 2 parts, gain 2 cogs. If you lose 3 or more parts, gain 1 smooth movement.

Name: Steampunk Rally: Red Green
Description:
Red Green is a promotional character for Steampunk Rally. Rather than having the standard two cards, a cockpit and a machine, Red green has a single 2×1 card depicting a van and trailer device.
  
Ability: You may attach parts without proper valve connections by spending a cog to mark them as "duct taped" together. You may not separate these parts. If a taped part is destroyed, separate it, regain the cog, and gain one die of the type in the card's corner. Dice regained in the Damage Phase are kept for the next round.

Name: Steampunk Rally: Spoiler
Description:
The spoiler is a promotional card for Steampunk Rally. The card is shuffled with the rest of the cards at the start of the game.

Ability: At the start of each Race Phase, place a fusion die from the supply on the track. If you finish the Race Phase on or adjacent to its space, gain it for the next round, otherwise, discard it.

Name: Amerika: Strategic Markers
Description:
These marker rules will help you incorporate additional rules into your AMERIKA game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, as well as adding new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Game of Puss in Boots
Description:
Puss in Boots is a roll-and-move game where the one player as Puss whose goal is to have his master marry the princess, and the other player as the King tries to thwart Puss in his attempt.

From McLoughlin Brothers' 1897 catalogue:

"This game is to decide whether Puss manages to marry his Master to the Princess or the King succeeds in outwitting the gifted but tricky feline. The play is of the simplest, being moves over a course by spins of the indicator, with suitable setbacks. The board and label are in full colors and gold"
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Puss in Boots

Name: The Noodle Game
Description:
The aim of The Noodle Game is to score the most points by picking up various value noodles from the box and placing them on your place without dropping them on the table.

At the start of the game, all players pick up their chopsticks, with the tips remaining in contact with their plates (the starting position). The youngest player starts and play continues clockwise. Each player, in turn, uses their chopsticks to try to pick up ONE noodle from the box and place in on their plate. Once the bottom end of the noodle leaves the box, the other players can lift their chopsticks from their plates and attempt to steal the noodle and place it on their own plate. Once any part of a noodle touches a plate, it is considered safe and cannot be stolen.

Name: Woo Boo
Description:
Woo Boo is an unusually judgmental game for friends, family, and total strangers. How well do you know your friends? And how well do they know you? Find out, as you take turns making opinions on three interesting topics, while other players try to guess what you really think. Will it be WOO or BOO? The answer isn't always black or white!

—description from the publisher

Name: Apex K-Truck Racer
Description:
Apex K-Truck Racer is a resource allocation competitive racing board game in which two to six players take on the role of truck drivers who guide their vehicles, fueled by kinetic power cubes, on smuggling missions through the abandoned streets and roads of the old world. The K-trucker who earns more reputation points throughout the game is declared the winner.

Thematically, the game begins immediately after the players have successfully stolen from a Corporation Conglomerate, collecting some cargo and a bit of information that reveals secret warehouses along the escape route, where more resources are hidden. Each game represents a smuggling run from point A, the Conglomerate gates, to point B, the agreed-upon Drop Spot.

The game is played over a series of rounds in which each player takes actions to manage the allocation of K-Cubes on different areas of the truck to add speed, power-up its guns or to activate the drone sidekick that improves the vehicle. By doing this, truckers create unique strategies to achieve different goals during the mission, which reward them with prestige among their peers and employers.

Players must be quick because the Corporation is hunting down the smugglers to recover its resources. Players must also keep an eye out for the other Truckers, who will try everything they can to collect additional cargo and get to the destination first, even if that means shooting down another truck.

—description from the designer

AWARDS & HONORS

2018 - Luso Design Awards (Portugal) - Product Design - Bronze
2018 - Luso Design Awards (Portugal) - Product Art - Bronze
2018 - Catarse Board Game Prototype Contest (Brazil) - Top 5
2018 - The Game Crafter´s Board Game Rules Sanity Test - 66/80.
2020 - The Game Crafter´s Board Game Rules Sanity Test - 77/80. 
       "Trucker combat race game has easy to follow rules and looks like it can carry a heavy load of fun." (Gamecrafter, June 2020)

Name: Global War 1936-1945: German & U.S. Ordnance Set #1
Description:
This set features new ordnance for use with Global War -2nd edition. This set introduces a new concept to Global War – the idea that players can spend IPPs for advanced ordnance they expend to improve their outcomes. Ordnance can improve combat values, grant the ability to select targets and in some cases give units abilities they don’t have, like being able to hunt IPPs on convoy lines.

-description from publisher
